text: @oofenshmirtz2911 you too
@feminist409 Ok thank you for being polite.
@oofenshmirtz2911 that’s ok, I definitely enjoyed this debate! If you would ever like to debate again, feel free to comment or private message me

@feminist409 Well I will just say that you handled that information well and were completely patient the entire way truly I am. I finally got to finish an argument without getting blocked. I apologize that I filled your inbox and I wish you a good day. I’m glad we agreed on something.
@oofenshmirtz2911 very true!!
@feminist409 well not completely it leaves only anger and selfishness out in my opinion.

@oofenshmirtz2911 I definitely agree, I believe the acting out using crime, drugs, alcohol, etc is because they are mad at the parent that isn’t there, not necessarily who is raising them. We definitely need to teach kids to control their emotions, but toxic masculinity shuts down emotions completely.

@feminist409 what I meant was that emotions can control everything and if you don’t teach your kid control what happens when another boy or girl make him mad? If he doesn’t have control what’s to stop him from killing or hurting the kids. And you’re absolutely right about the single parents part but if a boy or girl are raised by just their mother or father their chances of doing drugs and crime dramatically increase, a great example of that is black people. And I don’t mean to be racist and just to clarify in case you didn’t know, black people make up 30% of America yet they commit 70% of the crime, another thing that have is that 90% of black families are missing a father. And it doesn’t matter what race or gender the percentage still increases dramatically.

@oofenshmirtz2911 showing emotion does not make them less masculine, if anything it is more, it proves they can be strong and masculine, while being in control and being comfortable with their emotions. I definitely agree kids need mothers and fathers, but single parents do a wonderful job at raising children. That boy may have the best grandpa in the world, or a daughter may have a strong aunt. You can have parental figures in your life without them being your biological parents.

@feminist409 Well I apologize for grouping them together but I’ve seen a majority of them act that way so I interrupted it that way. And again a father will say to their son one point in their life that emotions are powerful, and that they can make powerful things both good and bad, it’s not about sealing them out it’s about control. That’s why we need more masculinity in kids not less, I don’t know how a woman feels or how I can possibly raise them, and a woman won’t know how a man feels, that’s what fathers and mothers are for. We need to keep families together, the divorce rate is pretty high and we need to see what’s causing that so we can fix it. If we fix it then most the toxicity that is plaguing the world would be gone.

@oofenshmirtz2911 I don’t agree with what that guy did he was over the top. Most men are taught to not show emotions such as sadness, that causes mental illness, this is a reason the male suicide rate is so high. Feminists, especially male feminists understand what toxic masculinity is actually about, which my post describes above. Male feminists are extremely strong and have control, don’t group them all together
@feminist409 I’m sorry am I pushing you. If I am I’m sorry you don’t have to continue this conversation if you don’t want to.

@feminist409 plus there is examples that show what happens if men completely diminish this attribute, it happens a lot in male feminist too, when they’re too concerned about toxic masculinity they become that guy who kicked a girl in the face just because she was not pro life.

@feminist409 it’s not like we’re emotionless either from a guy it’s never about hiding your emotions it’s more about control. Without that feature we would break down in a situation that needs us. Not having that quality is what causes wars, rape, and murder.

@oofenshmirtz2911 that does not change the fact that it has been proven that men not showing emotion has caused horrible mental problems, causes a large portion of suicides, and can damage their lives and careers. Women are able to show emotion and fight in wars or hunt other animals for food.
@trigger_snowflakes I do.
Toxic femininity. If feminism is about equality shouldn’t you advocate for both sides
Let me introduce to to toxic femininity where bullying,prejudice,manipulations,victimhood get worse
@oofenshmirtz2911 this is an example that shows that men need to be men they need to stay with the plan evolution has for them. It’s just the way it is.

@feminist409 well we still live in environments where some men need that trait in order to make a living for example we still need to hunt other animals for food, we still have to go to war whether we like it or not, and we still need to protect ourselves from well ourselves. But anyway back on track, be wary though some of the dates and numbers might be off and I can’t remember names if my life depended on it so I’m going to call the main characters bob and dill.
So in the 1980’s I believe there was this one doctor who at the time wondered if gender truly was a social construct. He wanted to test it out on boys since he couldn’t put a male penis on a girl, since the procedure was completely unethical he did the experiment illegally. When he saw 2 twin boys who had a problem with their penises he took that opportunity to burn their penises beyond surgical repair, he told the parents he accidentally burned them and told them that the best option was to dress them up as girls and give them estrogen pills, and to never tell the kids that they were boys. The parents of course listened and after 8 years of treating them as girls and giving them the estrogen pills bob and dill started having symptoms of trauma and the boys started acting wierdly as if they had some mental disorders, it was u til the age of 12 where they started to get really fucked up, they were extremely mentally challenged so badly that they thought the parents had beat them for years, and weirdly they chose that time to tell Dan and Bob that they were boys instead of girls, after this they started to get better little by little but it wasn’t enough and Dan and Bob committed suicide in their cars at the age of 18.
@oofenshmirtz2911 I think evolution is all about change, if they don’t start showing emotions it is almost like not evolving, but staying in the past

@feminist409 Well let’s start off that I am extremely happy that you did not answer angrily like most would have, and thank you for explaining clearly what you meant. But I will disagree that letting boys do something against their evolution is not harmful I will provide an example later of it being harmful but I gotta take a shower.

@oofenshmirtz2911 thanks I am having a good day. I think there was a misconception I am not saying men shouldn’t have masculine jobs, or like sports, but they also shouldn’t be forced to because it is masculine. Bullying is a problem that help, it causes suicide, and serious mental health problems. Catcalling is also a problem, saying hello is not catcalling, but being to led to smile, or that you have nice boobs, or ass is, and it should not happen. It was necessary in those times for men to not show emotion, but it is not part of you genetics, you can help it, and teach the next generation it is ok. Teaching boys it is ok to cry will not mess them up mentally, if anything it will help them. Hope you have a nice day, also!

The no emotion thing is something that we carried on as evolution progressed, it was mainly because we were built for hunting and many men died as they hunted, if we were not to have this trait then, well most of the men there would have been unable to hunt and that would have caused many problems. So that is something we cannot help. And you can’t change evolution by saying you can cry whenever you want, it’s going to screw them up mentally. The traditional male jobs is because most women don’t want to do those jobs, we aren’t holding you back it’s your decision if you want to do that. Plus men are more likely to take risk and they even tend to like it, or they just really like the job. Bullying is not just a masculine trait, if you think that we can live in a world without bullying you’re living in a fantasy plus the way the child acts is the parents who raised them fault and  partially the kids. I don’t see what’s wrong with liking sports, you’re out there to have fun. And with the catcalling thing,(just in case you think this way) just because a man says hello to you randomly or good morning is not cat calling he’s just polite. Have a good day.
